in_ports.name: contours
in_ports.hint: Existing contours: serialized array of several contours.

out_ports.name: object_label
out_ports.hint: Label: int value, corresponding to this contour.

out_ports.name: internal_boundary
out_ports.hint: Indicator of internal contour: 1 for internal contour, 0 for external contour.

out_ports.name: frame_id
out_ports.hint:
32-bit ID of the frame (submatrix), containing this contour.
If there is no frame ID, stays to be non-initialized.

controls.name: contourIndex
controls.caption: Contour index
controls.description: Index of the extracted contour in the source contours array.

controls.name: unpackContour
controls.caption: Unpack contour
controls.description: If set and if a contour is stored with optimizing collinear steps, it is automatically unpacked: result will always consist of segments with length 1.

controls.name: unpackDiagonals
controls.caption: Enforce unpacking diagonals
controls.description: If set and if "Unpack contour" is set, this procedure unpacks also non-horizontal and non-vertical segments of the contours (when they exists): they are converted to a series of segments (1,0) or (0,1). Such "diagonal" segments are usually considered as incorrect and should not appear while scanning binary objects, but can be added to contour array manually.
